thread.title: Top NITs Accepting Admission with 7000 rank in NIMCET 2025 - Getmyuni
thread.title_full: Top NITs Accepting Admission with 7000 rank in NIMCET 2025 - Getmyuni

author: @getmyuniedu
title: Top NITs Accepting Admission with 7000 rank in NIMCET 2025 - Getmyuni
text:
According to the previous year trends, the list of NITs for 7000 rank in NIMCET 2025 include NIT Agartala, NIT Raipur, and NIT Patna. The final allocation will be done during the NIMCET counselling 2025.
The list of NITs for 7000 rank in NIMCET 2025 comprises NIT Meghalaya, NIT Patna, NIT Agartala, and others, where there is less demand for MCA programs. The final seat allocation will be done based on the
NIMCET 2025 cutoff, which will be released during the counselling process.
NIMCET is the national-level exam for admission to
MCA programs at participating NITs. Thus, candidates willing to gain admission to any of the institutes with a 7000 rank in NIMCET must keep a check on the probable list.
In practice, a rank as high as 7000 is not considered strong – even mid-tier NITs often have closing ranks in the low hundreds. In general, a 7000 rank would only secure admission under certain reserved categories (SC/ST) at NITs with very high cutoffs. The following sections list the NITs that historically had very high closing ranks (often via reserved seats), explain key factors, and outline the admission process.
NITs for 7000 Rank in NIMCET 2025 for MCA Admission
Very few NITs fill seats around rank 7000 through
NIMCET 2025. In the last few years, only reserved-category seats at certain NITs closed that high. For example, in NIMCET 2024, the ST cutoff at NIT Patna was about 7771-7956, and at NITK Surathkal (ST) it was around 4654. By contrast, open-category cutoffs at Allahabad and Surathkal were only ~180 and ~114. The table below lists some NITs that typically have the highest closing ranks (often via SC/ST seats), along with their approximate closing rank range and average MCA tuition fee:

Each closing-rank range above is an estimate based on previous years’ cutoffs. For instance, NIT Patna’s MCA ST seats closed near 7956, while Allahabad’s ST was ~4893. General-category seats at these NITs have much lower cutoffs (e.g. Allahabad ~180), so a 7000 rank in the General category would not be enough. The fees are typical annual tuition; actual fees may vary by institute.
Is 7000 Rank in NIMCET 2025 Good?
A rank of 7000 in NIMCET is generally not good – it falls into the “Poor” performance zone. Candidates with a rank in the 6001–10000 range are usually admitted only in very limited cases (often via ST/SC quotas). Below is a general grade chart showing the
NIMCET marks vs rank analysis 2025:

NIMCET Closing Ranks 2025(Expected)
The closing ranks for admission of candidates, as allocated, most likely followed a similar pattern throughout all ten participating NITs. It is important to remember that to secure a position at each NIT, you must pay attention to the previously mentioned anticipated NIMCET Cut Off 2025. The official closing ranks for each institute are listed in the table below, which candidates can use to determine their category-wise ranking:
|NIT||OPEN||OBC-NCL||SC||ST|
|NIT Trichy||40||100||450||1100|
|NIT Warangal||90||210||520||1300|
|NIT Surathkal||180||320||750||1700|
|NIT Allahabad||220||400||900||2000|
|NIT Calicut||265||500||1000||2400|
|NIT Bhopal||320||560||1200||2600|
|NIT Jamshedpur||525||780||1800||3600|
|NIT Durgapur||470||720||1600||3300|
|NIT Kurukshetra||545||800||2000||3900|
|NIT Raipur||649||860||2400||4200|
|NIT Patna||670||900||4200||7900|
|NIT Agartala||690||950||4500||8200|
How to Verify the NIMCET Cutoff 2025?
The NIMCET Cut Off 2025 is anticipated to be made public on the organisation's official website, where all applicants can access it. Candidates can use these steps to view the cut-off marks:
-
Firstly, go to the organisation's official website.
-
Locate the notification link for the NIMCET Cut Off 2025 marks on the homepage.
-
In step three, click that link. The screen will display the cutoff marks.
-
Download the cut-off PDF file according to its screen display and print it out as needed.
A 7000 rank falls in the “Poor” band. In practical terms, except for SC/ST candidates (who have their own cutoffs), a 7000 rank in the general category would not secure admission in any NIT. Even for SC/ST, only the very highest close (like NIT Patna’s ST close ~7956) allows anything near rank 7000. All other ST/SC cutoffs were much lower (e.g. Surathkal ST ~4654).
